title: BJP takes ‘mental stability’ jibe at Rahul Gandhi over his ‘fighting Indian state’ remark - Hindustan Times
'Name It After Manmohan Singh': BJP Slams Congress Over Posters Outside New Headquarters - News18
summary:
BJP Challenges Congress to Honor Manmohan Singh with New Headquarters Name

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: News18

In a controversial move, BJP leaders have criticized Congress for naming its new headquarters after Indira Gandhi instead of the former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, which has sparked a public call for honoring Singh's legacy.

  • Posters outside the new Congress headquarters demand it be named 'Sardar Manmohan Singh Bhavan'.
  • BJP's Amit Malviya shared a video of the posters and criticized Congress for ignoring Singh's legacy.
  • Malviya pointed out that Rahul Gandhi's actions during Singh's mourning were disrespectful.
  • Manmohan Singh passed away at 92, and his legacy continues to be a point of political contention.
“Posters outside the new Congress headquarters call for it to be named Sardar Manmohan Singh Bhavan, as a tribute to the former Prime Minister.” - Amit Malviya

The BJP's remarks highlight the ongoing political rivalry and the importance of honoring political legacies in contemporary India.
newTitle: BJP Challenges Congress to Honor Manmohan Singh with New Headquarters Name

title: BJP's Ramesh Bidhuri compares Delhi CM Atishi with deer: ‘Hirni Jaisi Ghoom Rahi’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
BJP's Ramesh Bidhuri Compares Delhi CM Atishi with Deer: ‘Hirni Jaisi Ghoom Rahi’

Date: Jan 15, 2025 03:19 PM IST Source: Hindustan Times

BJP leader Ramesh Bidhuri has sparked controversy once again by comparing Delhi Chief Minister Atishi to a “deer” while criticizing her for not engaging with residents in her constituency.

  • Bidhuri's comments come ahead of the Delhi assembly elections scheduled for February 5.
  • He accused Atishi of ignoring the public and only making appearances during election season, saying she roams the streets like a deer.
  • This is not the first time Bidhuri has made a controversial remark about Atishi.
  • Atishi responded emotionally to Bidhuri's comments, defending her father's legacy as a teacher and condemning the attacks on her character.
  • The Delhi BJP has called for political leaders to avoid personal attacks during campaigns.
“I never thought that this country's politics could stoop so low,” - Atishi, responding to Bidhuri's remarks.

The political climate is heated as the elections approach, with both parties engaging in a war of words.
newTitle: BJP's Ramesh Bidhuri Compares Delhi CM Atishi to a Deer

title: ‘Inadvertent error': Meta India apologises for Mark Zuckerberg's remark on 2024 elections - Hindustan Times
summary:
Meta India Apologizes for Zuckerberg's Remarks on 2024 Elections

Publication Date: January 15, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Meta India has issued an apology for comments made by CEO Mark Zuckerberg regarding the 2024 elections in India, clarifying that the remark about the incumbent government losing due to its COVID-19 handling was an 'inadvertent error'.

  • Mark Zuckerberg claimed that many incumbent governments lost elections worldwide, including India.
  • Meta India's vice president, Shivnath Thukral, emphasized India’s importance and issued the apology via a post on X.
  • BJP MP Nishikant Dubey criticized the misinformation and stated that Meta would be summoned by his committee.
  • Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw countered Zuckerberg's statement, highlighting India's successful 2024 elections with over 640 million voters.
“The people of India reaffirmed their trust in the NDA led by PM Narendra Modi's leadership.” — Ashwini Vaishnaw

This incident underscores the sensitivity surrounding misinformation and the significance of accurate statements by international figures regarding local democratic processes.
newTitle: Meta India Apologizes for Zuckerberg's Remarks on 2024 Elections

summary:
Congress' ugly truth exposed: Nadda slams Rahul's 'fight against Indian State' remark

Rahul Gandhi criticizes Mohan Bhagwat's remarks on India's independence, framing Congress's battle as against the BJP, RSS, and the Indian State.

  • Mohan Bhagwat's statement about independence and Ram Mandir sparked controversy.
  • Rahul Gandhi labeled the comments as treasonous, claiming a fight against the BJP and the Indian State.
  • Sonia Gandhi inaugurated the Congress's new HQ amidst political tensions.
  • Kejriwal dismisses life threats, attributing his safety to divine protection.
Nadda calls out Congress, stating, "Hidden no more, Congress’ ugly truth now stands exposed by their own leader."

The ongoing political conflict showcases deepening divides within Indian politics as leaders from both Congress and BJP intensify their rhetoric.

title: On Mumbai visit, PM Narendra Modi meets Mahayuti MLAs over lunch, months after Maharashtra election victory - Hindustan Times
summary:
PM Narendra Modi Meets Mahayuti MLAs Over Lunch

Date: Jan 15, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

During his Mumbai visit, PM Narendra Modi held a luncheon with MLAs of the BJP-led Mahayuti coalition to celebrate their significant victory in the recent Maharashtra elections.

  • Modi met MLAs at the INS Angre Auditorium in Mumbai.
  • The Mahayuti coalition won 230 out of 288 seats in the November assembly elections.
  • Key attendees included Maharashtra chief minister Devendra Fadnavis and his deputies Eknath Shinde and Ajit Pawar.
  • Modi also commissioned three new naval combatants on the same day, highlighting India's defense progress.
  • He is scheduled to inaugurate an ISKCON temple later, emphasizing cultural promotion.
“India is swiftly progressing towards becoming the world's third-largest economy.” - PM Narendra Modi

This event signifies the Mahayuti coalition's strong political position in Maharashtra and showcases PM Modi's continued efforts in bolstering defense and cultural initiatives.
newTitle: PM Modi Meets Mahayuti MLAs in Mumbai to Celebrate Election Victory

title: Meta apologises for Mark Zuckerberg's Indian elections remarks: ‘Inadvertent error’ - Moneycontrol
summary:
Meta Apologizes for Mark Zuckerberg's Indian Elections Remarks: ‘Inadvertent Error’

Date: January 15, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Meta India has issued an apology regarding comments made by Mark Zuckerberg about the Indian elections, calling them an “inadvertent error.”

  • Meta's vice president, Shivnath Thukral, acknowledged the mistake in a post.
  • The apology follows remarks by Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, who labeled Zuckerberg's comments as “factually incorrect.”
  • India conducted its general elections in 2024, with over 640 million voters participating.
“We would like to apologise for this inadvertent error. India remains an incredibly important country for Meta.” - Shivnath Thukral

Meta's acknowledgment of the error underlines the platform's commitment to accuracy and the significance of India in its operational strategy.
newTitle: Meta Apologizes for Mark Zuckerberg's Comments on Indian Elections: 'Inadvertent Error'

title: Supreme Court grants interim protection from arrest to ex-IAS trainee Puja Khedkar - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Grants Interim Protection from Arrest to Ex-IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar

Published on: 15 Jan 2025, 7:45 am

The Supreme Court has ordered no coercive steps against Puja Khedkar, a former IAS trainee accused of fraudulently availing reservation benefits while sitting for the UPSC exam, until further notice.

  • The Court's order comes as Khedkar appealed against the Delhi High Court's rejection of her anticipatory bail plea.
  • Khedkar is accused of misusing reservation meant for Other Backward Classes (OBC) and Persons with Benchmark Disabilities.
  • The Supreme Court issued a notice to the state and scheduled the next hearing for 14 February 2025.
  • Senior Advocate Siddharth Luthra represents Khedkar and argues for her protection claiming strong findings against her.
  • After allegations surfaced, the UPSC cancelled her selection and permanently barred her from future exams.

“If matter goes to trial there will be conviction.. there are strong findings.”

The Supreme Court's decision offers temporary respite for Khedkar as she navigates the legal challenges ahead.
newTitle: Supreme Court Grants Interim Protection from Arrest to Ex-IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar

title: Supreme Court stays arrest of ex-IAS trainee Puja Khedkar in UPSC cheating case - Hindustan Times
summary:
Supreme Court Stays Arrest of Former IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar in UPSC Cheating Case

Date: Jan 15, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Supreme Court has ordered a stay on the arrest of former IAS officer Puja Khedkar, accused of fraudulently appearing for the UPSC civil service examination in 2022. The court issued a notice to the Delhi Police and the UPSC regarding her plea for anticipatory bail.

  • Puja Khedkar is accused of misrepresenting information to avail reservation benefits in her UPSC application.
  • The Delhi High Court previously rejected her anticipatory bail request, citing a strong prima facie case.
  • The Supreme Court has scheduled a hearing for February 14 and ordered that no coercive action be taken against her in the meantime.
  • Delhi Police assert that a deeper investigation is needed due to emerging conspiracy allegations.
“It's a classic example of fraud, not only with a constitutional body but also with society and the nation as a whole.”

The Supreme Court's intervention provides temporary relief to Khedkar as the legal battle continues around her allegations.
newTitle: Supreme Court Stays Arrest of Former IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar in UPSC Cheating Case

title: Supreme Court's shocker to KTR - Deccan Chronicle
summary:
Supreme Court's Decision Affects KTR in Formula E Race Scam

Date: January 9, 2025 Source: Deccan Chronicle

The Supreme Court declined to entertain a quash petition filed by K T Rama Rao concerning the Formula E race scam, leading to withdrawal of the petition and clearing legal obstacles for an investigation.

  • The Supreme Court dismissed KTR's quash petition regarding the Formula E race scandal.
  • KTR withdrew the petition after the court's refusal, acknowledging the need for investigation.
  • The Telangana High Court had mentioned a prima facie case of misuse of public funds.
  • The ED has summoned KTR to appear for questioning on Thursday.
The case warranted investigation. - Supreme Court

This development signifies a crucial step towards addressing allegations against KTR and the potential financial misconduct related to the event.
newTitle: Supreme Court's Decision Affects KTR in Formula E Race Scam

title: Formula-E case: Supreme Court's shocker to KTR - Greatandhra
summary:
Supreme Court Rejects KTR's Plea in Formula-E Case

Publication Date: January 15, 2023

Source: Great Andhra

The Supreme Court has dealt a significant blow to K T Rama Rao, rejecting his petition to quash the FIR related to the Formula-E car race case. The court upheld the investigation into alleged financial irregularities.

  • The Supreme Court refused to interfere with the ongoing investigation.
  • KTR's legal counsel withdrew the petition seeking to overturn the high court's decision.
  • The case involves claims of financial mismanagement during the Formula-E race in Hyderabad.
  • The Telangana government has filed a caveat, ensuring it can present its arguments before any decisions are made.
“It is not appropriate to quash the case which is still in the investigation stage.” - Mukul Rohatgi, Senior Lawyer

This ruling marks a significant moment in ongoing legal challenges faced by KTR, as he continues to contest the findings related to the Formula-E event.
newTitle: Supreme Court Rejects KTR's Plea in Formula-E Case

title: Mumbai News Live Updates: India set to become major maritime power, says PM Modi as Navy gets 3 new frontline combatants - The Indian Express
summary:
India Set to Become Major Maritime Power as PM Modi Commissions Three New Naval Combatants

Date: 15 January 2025
Source: Indian Express

Prime Minister Narendra Modi commissioned three new naval frontline combatants in Mumbai, stating that India is on the path to becoming a significant maritime power.

  • INS Surat and INS Nilgiri are part of a new class of warships designed to enhance India’s naval capabilities.
  • PM Modi emphasized the importance of securing trade routes and protecting territorial waters.
  • These ships represent a crucial step in enhancing India's military and maritime strength.
  • India is exporting defense equipment to over 100 countries, reflecting its growing defense production.
“It is important to protect territorial waters, freedom of navigation, and secure trade supply lines and sea routes.” - PM Modi

This commissioning marks a pivotal movement in enhancing India's naval strength and global standing.
newTitle: India Set to Become Major Maritime Power as PM Modi Commissions Three New Naval Combatants

title: 'Non-sense, it's treason': Rahul Gandhi slams RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's ‘true Independence’ statement - Hindustan Times
summary:
Rahul Gandhi Critiques RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat's Independence Remarks

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Rahul Gandhi launched a strong attack on RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat for his statement that India's 'true independence' began with the construction of the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya, calling it treason and an insult to Indians.

  • Mohan Bhagwat claimed India attained 'true independence' with the Ram Mandir consecration.
  • Rahul Gandhi condemned Bhagwat's remarks, stating they undermine India's independence movement and the Constitution.
  • The statements have sparked widespread political backlash.
“What he said yesterday is treason because it states that the Constitution is invalid, and the fight against the British was invalid.” - Rahul Gandhi

In conclusion, Gandhi's criticism highlights ongoing political tensions and differing views on India's historical narrative.
newTitle: Rahul Gandhi Critiques RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat's Independence Remarks

PM Modi commissions 3 naval warships in Mumbai - The Hindu
summary:
PM Modi Commissions 3 Naval Warships in Mumbai

Date: January 15, 2025
Source: The Hindu

The Indian Navy commissioned three new warships, INS Surat, INS Nilgiri, and INS Vaghsheer, in Mumbai, emphasizing India's growing maritime power and role as a responsible global partner.

  • Three naval warships were commissioned: a destroyer, a frigate, and a submarine.
  • Prime Minister Modi highlighted India's commitment to a secure and inclusive Indo-Pacific region.
  • Emphasis on the ‘Atmanirbhar Bharat’ initiative promoting self-reliance in defense.
  • Over the last decade, India inducted 33 ships and seven submarines into its navy.
  • India’s defense production has reached ₹1.25 lakh crore, with exports to over 100 countries.
“We should become a global partner in securing the sea from drugs, weapons and terrorism and make it safe and prosperous.”

In conclusion, the commissioning of these warships marks a significant step in enhancing India's naval capabilities and its commitment to global maritime security.
newTitle: PM Modi Commissions New Naval Warships in Mumbai

title: 9A, Kotla Road: Congress gets new headquarters ‘Indira Bhawan’ in Sonia Gandhi, Mallikarjun Kharge's presence - Hindustan Times
summary:
Congress Inaugurates New Headquarters 'Indira Bhawan' in New Delhi

Date: Jan 15, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

The Congress party has officially inaugurated its new headquarters, Indira Bhawan, at 9A Kotla Road in New Delhi, marking a significant transition after 47 years at its previous location, 24 Akbar Road.

  • Sonia Gandhi, Congress Parliamentary Party chief, led the inauguration ceremony.
  • Key party leaders including Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi participated in the event.
  • The move symbolizes a potential resurgence for the party following losses in recent elections.
  • Supporting speeches emphasized the significance of this new beginning for the party and nation.
  • Rahul Gandhi criticized RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's remarks about the Indian Constitution during the event.
"It is a new beginning. We are very happy that we have a new headquarters. I hope this will bring better things for the party and the country." - Sachin Pilot

The inauguration of Indira Bhawan is seen as a strategic move for the Congress party, aiming to revitalize its operations and outreach as it navigates through challenging political waters.
newTitle: Congress Inaugurates New Headquarters 'Indira Bhawan' in New Delhi

title: Dr. V. Narayanan Assumed Charge of Secretary, Department of Space and Chairman, Space Commission - ISRO
‘Mohan Bhagwat has committed treason… attacked the Constitution’: Rahul Gandhi at launch of Congress’s new headquarters - The Indian Express
summary:
‘We are fighting BJP, RSS, and the Indian state itself’: Rahul Gandhi hits out at Mohan Bhagwat

Publication Date: January 15, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

During the inauguration of Congress's new headquarters, Rahul Gandhi criticized BJP and RSS for allegedly capturing all institutions in India, asserting that Mohan Bhagwat's comments on India's independence were treasonous.

  • Gandhi claimed that the RSS chief's remarks undermined the true significance of India's independence in 1947.
  • He emphasized the Congress vision as one that respects diverse languages and cultures.
  • Gandhi described Bhagwat's perspective as a centralized ideology that threatens democratic values.
  • He warned against the agenda that seeks to suppress the voices of marginalized communities in India.
“To say that India did not get Independence in 1947 is an insult to every single Indian.” - Rahul Gandhi

The confrontation highlights an ideological clash between Congress and RSS, with Gandhi positioning Congress as the defender of India's secular and democratic fabric.
newTitle: Rahul Gandhi Criticizes RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat at Congress Headquarters Inauguration

title: Kerala High Court Pulls Up Boby Chemmannur For Staying In Jail Despite Grant Of Bail - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Kerala High Court Criticizes Boby Chemmanur for Delaying Bail Release

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Live Law

The Kerala High Court has warned Boby Chemmanur about the potential cancellation of his bail in a sexual harassment case filed by a Malayalam movie actress due to his delay in securing release.

  • The court noticed that although a release order was issued, it was not produced, leading to suspicions of a media attention-seeking tactic.
  • Justice P. V. Kunhikrishnan stated Boby Chemmanur may face cancellation of bail if he does not comply.
  • Boby Chemmanur was granted bail following the Supreme Court's ruling on bail criteria.
  • He has been accused of sexual harassment during a public event and making inappropriate remarks on social media.
“He is playing with the High Court...Is this the manner in which an accused behaves?”

The court emphasized that Boby Chemmanur must refrain from making remarks against the judiciary in the future.
newTitle: Kerala High Court Criticizes Boby Chemmanur for Delaying Bail Release

title: Mahakumbh 2025 Live: Devotees take holy dip at Triveni Sangam on day 3 - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mahakumbh 2025: Day 3 Highlights at Triveni Sangam

Publication Date: Jan 15, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

On the third day of the Mahakumbh Mela, over 35 million devotees gathered at Triveni Sangam for a holy dip, marking the Makar Sankranti festival. The event continues to draw immense crowds as preparations for upcoming bathing days are underway.

Key Points

  • More than 35 million devotees participated on the first 'Amrit Snan' day, according to UP CM Yogi Adityanath.
  • Naga Sadhus led the procession of akharas for the holy bath.
  • The Mahakumbh Mela, occurring every 12 years, began on January 13 and will conclude on February 26.
  • Schools in Prayagraj for classes 1 to 8 are closed due to traffic congestion related to the event.
“Today, on the first Amrit Snan festival, more than 3.50 crore revered saints and devotees earned the holy benefit of bathing in the uninterrupted-clean Triveni.” – Yogi Adityanath

The Mahakumbh Mela is expected to gather up to 450 million attendees throughout its duration, highlighting the significance and scale of this religious event.
newTitle: Mahakumbh 2025: Day 3 Highlights at Triveni Sangam

title: Delhi dense fog: Over 100 flights delayed at IGI Airport; 26 trains hit - Hindustan Times
summary:
Dense Fog Causes Major Disruptions in Delhi-NCR: Over 100 Flights and 26 Trains Delayed

Date: January 15, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Thick layers of fog in Delhi-NCR have caused significant disruptions, resulting in delays for over 100 flights and 26 trains. Visibility conditions have been severely impacted, particularly in areas like Noida and Ghaziabad.

  • Delhi experienced complete zero or low visibility in the morning, with some areas affected by a cold wave.
  • The India Meteorological Department anticipated light rain or drizzle and forecasted minimum temperatures of 9°C.
  • A total of 26 trains were reported delayed, with some experiencing delays up to 328 minutes.
  • More than 100 flights were also delayed at IGI Airport due to the fog, although no cancellations occurred.
“Low visibility and fog over Delhi may lead to some delays. We are keeping a close watch on the weather.” - IndiGo Airlines

The heavy fog is expected to continue impacting transportation in the region for the next few days.
newTitle: Dense Fog Causes Major Disruptions in Delhi-NCR: Over 100 Flights and 26 Trains Delayed

title: Delhi liquor policy scam: MHA grants ED sanction to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal in excise policy case - The Hindu
J&K Govt recalls Executive Engineer from RDD and posted in PWD division - Cross Town News
Delhi liquor policy case: ED gets nod to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia; AAP says ‘1st case in history…’ | Today News - Mint
summary:
Delhi liquor policy case: ED gets nod to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia; AAP says ‘1st case in history…’

Publication Date: January 15, 2025

Source: PTI

In a significant development for the Aam Aadmi Party, the Union Home Ministry has authorized the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal and Manish Sisodia in connection with the Delhi liquor policy scam.

Key Points

  • The ED can now take action against Kejriwal and Sisodia under the anti-money laundering law.
  • AAP claims this is the first instance of the ED prosecuting leaders who were previously granted bail.
  • Kejriwal has been labeled as the 'kingpin' of the alleged liquor policy scam.
  • The charges relate to the now-scrapped Delhi Excise Policy that allowed private companies to participate in liquor sales.
“This will be the first such case in the history of the country where you jailed Arvind Kejriwal and Manish Sisodia,” said AAP spokesperson Priyanka Kakkar.

This recent action comes just ahead of the Delhi Assembly Elections, prompting the AAP to criticize the union government for politicizing legal actions against its leaders.
newTitle: Delhi liquor policy case: ED gets nod to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia; AAP says ‘1st case in history…’

title: Maha Kumbh: Devotees brave biting cold to take holy dip in Sangam - The Hindu
summary:
Maha Kumbh: Devotees brave biting cold to take holy dip in Sangam

Devotees are gathering at the Triveni Sangam to participate in the Maha Kumbh festival despite harsh biting cold, showcasing their enthusiasm and dedication.

  • Devotees are chanting religious hymns as they prepare to take a dip.
  • Many first-time attendees share their positive experiences and the support of safety arrangements by the administration.
  • Significant attendance with around 3.5 crore devotees present on Makar Sankranti.
  • The event includes traditional performances by Naga sadhus, enhancing the festive atmosphere.
  • The Kumbh is noted to be held every 12 years, with this being an especially auspicious occasion occurring after 144 years.
"It was for the first time that I took a dip in Sangam. After taking the dip, I really felt refreshed," said Nibar Chaudhary.

The Maha Kumbh festival attracts millions, with its blend of religious fervor and cultural celebrations marking a significant spiritual milestone for attendees.
newTitle: Maha Kumbh: Devotees Brave Cold for Holy Dip
